Welcome to idtracker.ai’s documentation!¶

idtracker.ai [1] allows to track groups of animals in videos realised in laboratory conditions.

The usage of information from this webpage must reference the article in [1]:

Romero-Ferrero, F., Bergomi, M.G., Hinz, R.C., Heras, F.J.H., De Polavieja, G.G., (2018). idtracker.ai: Tracking all individuals with correct identities in large animal collectives (submitted)

Contents:

  • Some videos tracked with idtracker.ai
    • Large groups of fish (D. rerio)
    • Small groups of fish (D. rerio)
    • Large groups of flies (D. melanogaster)
    • Small groups of flies (D. melanogaster)
  • Installation and requirements
    • Requirements
    • Installation
  • Quickstart
    • Step 1. Download the video example
    • Step 2. Copy video to an adequate location
    • Step 3. Start a tracking session
    • Step 4. Select a region of interests
    • Step 5. Video segmentation and preprocessing
    • Step 6. Start tracking the video
    • Step 7. Global and individual validation
    • Step 8. Output files
  • Graphical user interface (GUI)
    • Tab 1. Welcome
    • Tab 2. ROI selection
    • Tab 3. Preprocessing
    • Tab 4. Tracking
    • Tab 5. Validation
  • Modules
    • Preprocessing
    • DCD: Deep Crossing detector
    • Fragmentation
    • Identification network
    • Fingerprint protocol cascade
    • Post-processing
    • Human validation
    • Video information manager
